QAPair.Question: What is (are) Estrogen overdose ?
QAPair.Answer: Estrogen is a female hormone. Estrogen overdose occurs when someone takes more than the normal or recommended amount of a product containing the hormone. This can be by accident or on purpose. This article is for information only. DO NOT use it to treat or manage an actual overdose. If you or someone you are with overdoses, call your local emergency number (such as 911), or your local poison control center can be reached directly by calling the national toll-free Poison Help hotline (1-800-222-1222) from anywhere in the United States.

QAPair.Question: What are the symptoms of Estrogen overdose ?
QAPair.Answer: Symptoms of an estrogen overdose include: Breast tenderness, Discolored urine, Emotional changes, Drowsiness, Excessive vaginal bleeding (2 to 7 days after overdose), Fluid retention, Headache, Nausea and vomiting, Skin rash,

QAPair.Question: What to do for Estrogen overdose ?
What is the outlook for Estrogen overdose ?
